clinical_study.brief_title: BiLAteral Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation for Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnoea (BLAST OSA)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Prospective, Open-label, Non-randomized, Single Arm Treatment Study to Assess the Safety, Performance and Initial Efficacy Trends of the Genio(TM) Bilateral Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation System for the Treatment of Obstructive Sleep Apnoea.

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed as a prospective, open-label, multicentre, non-randomized, single arm treatment study to assess the safety, performance and initial efficacy trends of the GenioTM System in patients with Obstructive Sleep Apnoea (OSA).

primary_outcome.measure: Safety (Incidence of serious device-related adverse events)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of serious device-related adverse events
Change from baseline to 6-month post implantation in the apnoea-hypopnea index (AHI)

intervention.intervention_name: Genio(TM) bilateral hypoglossal nerve stimulation system
intervention.description: Subjects will be consented, enrolled and eligibility criteria checked. If the subject is eligible, subject will proceed with the Genio(TM) implant implantation. Four (4) weeks after implantation, the implant will be activated and the subject will be assessed at 1 month plus 1 week, 2, 3, 4 and 6 month(s) after implantation.

- Significant co-morbidities making the patient unable or inappropriate to participate in the trial
